com.poesys.accounting.dataloader

Interface IBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OldDataBuilder

    public interface IBuilder
    The Builder component of a Builder pattern system that builds a "new" accounting system for a specific fiscal year with a series of process steps. Implementations may load old accounting data from disk files or may provide unit test data created in memory.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Method Detail

      • buildFiscalYear

        void buildFiscalYear(java.lang.Integer year)
        Build a fiscal year object based on a specified integer year. This is the initial step in the build process, and it clears any existing year-based data to provide a clean build for the specified year. It leaves the shared data structures passed through the constructor arguments, such as account groups, accounts, and receivable-account-item lookups.
        Parameters:
        year - the year number

      • buildAccountGroups

        void buildAccountGroups()
        Build a set of account groups. The implementation should accept a current set of account groups through the constructor and add any new groups to the set from input data. Depends on buildFiscalYear().

      • buildAccountMap

        void buildAccountMap()
        Build a map of new-accounting account names indexed by current-fiscal-year account number. This map provides a mapping for the current year's accounts identified by account number to the new-accounting accounts identified by name. It also permits mapping account-number changes from year to year for balance sheet accounts. Depends on buildFiscalYear().

      • buildAccounts

        void buildAccounts()
        Build the set of accounts from input data. Depends on buildAccountMap().

      • buildBalances

        void buildBalances()
        Build the set of balance transactions from input data. Call this method only for the first fiscal year; the new accounting system maintains only the initial balances for the entity, not an annual balance. Depends on buildAccounts().

      • buildTransactions

        void buildTransactions()
        Build the set of transactions and items from input data. The implementation should throw a RuntimeException if there is any invalid transaction. Depends on buildAccounts().

      • buildReimbursements

        void buildReimbursements()
        Build the reimbursement links between receivable items and reimbursing items. Depends on buildTransactions(), which creates all the items needed for linking (receivable and reimbursement items).

      • getPath

        java.lang.String getPath()
        Get the data file path.
        Returns:
        a path string

      • getFiscalYear

        FiscalYear getFiscalYear()
        Get the fiscal year.
        Returns:
        the fiscal year

      • getCapitalStructure

        CapitalStructure getCapitalStructure()
        Get the accounting system's capital structure. This is available immediately after construction of the builder.
        Returns:
        the capital structure

      • getAccountGroups

        java.util.Set<AccountGroup> getAccountGroups()
        Get the set of account groups.
        Returns:
        the set of account groups

      • getAccounts

        java.util.Set<Account> getAccounts()
        Get the set of accounts.
        Returns:
        the set of accounts

      • getAccountByName

        Account getAccountByName(java.lang.String name)
        Get an account by looking it up by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to look up
        Returns:
        the account corresponding to the name, or null if there is none by that name

      • readFile

        void readFile(java.io.Reader reader,
              OldDataBuilder.IBuildStrategy strategy)
        Internal method to read a file
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader pointing to current input data
        strategy - the strategy with which to build the DTOs from input data
